result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

15CM1892 - Ct. 5 (Misd BJ)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CM1892 (Cts. 1, 3, 4, and 5) ONLY>> 9 months MCJ on each count, concurrent to each other, w/credit for 40 days of time already served, to begin within 45 days of today's date, w/huber for work if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, Defendant must report to probation today after release, or if they are closed when released, he must report by 9:30am 11/17/15, CC and DNA surcharge (no DNA sample ordered).

In all other counts plead to>>Sentence W/held on all counts; 3 years Probation on each count, concurrent to each other and to jail time in 15CM1892.
CONDITIONS: Safe program intake and any recommended follow up; Any other assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; AODA; Absolute sobriety; Random UAs as directed by PO; No possession of controlled substances unless as prescribed to defendant and then only as prescription allows; CC including 2 domestic abuse assessments; DNA sample and one DNA surcharge for EACH FILE; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or for any week defendant does not meet that condition, he must perform 10 hours of C.S./week; No contact w/victims S.P., or A.V., whatsoever, no contact w/EK. unless as approved by PO.
No restitution is requested or ordered.
